The embed tag combines the behavior of include and extends. It allows you to include another template’s contents, just like include does. But it also allows you to override any block defined inside the included template, like when extending a template.

The embed tag combines the behaviour of include and extends. It allows you to include another template's contents, just like include does. But it also allows you to override any block defined inside the included template, like when extending a template.
trans-unit.target: La etiqueta embed combina el comportamiento de include y extensions . Te permite incluir el contenido de otra plantilla, como hace include . Pero también le permite anular cualquier bloque definido dentro de la plantilla incluida, como cuando se extiende una plantilla.

trans-unit.source: The embed tag takes the exact same arguments as the include tag:
trans-unit.target: La etiqueta de embed toma exactamente los mismos argumentos que la etiqueta de include :

trans-unit.source: The embed tag takes the idea of template inheritance to the level of content fragments. While template inheritance allows for "document skeletons", which are filled with life by child templates, the embed tag allows you to create "skeletons" for smaller units of content and re-use and fill them anywhere you like.
trans-unit.target: La etiqueta embed lleva la idea de herencia de plantillas al nivel de fragmentos de contenido. Mientras que la herencia de plantillas permite "esqueletos de documentos", que se llenan de vida con las plantillas secundarias, la etiqueta embed permite crear "esqueletos" para unidades más pequeñas de contenido y reutilizarlos y llenarlos en cualquier lugar que desee.

trans-unit.source: The embed tag takes the idea of template inheritance to the level of content fragments. While template inheritance allows for “document skeletons”, which are filled with life by child templates, the embed tag allows you to create “skeletons” for smaller units of content and re-use and fill them anywhere you like.

trans-unit.source: The escaper extension adds automatic output escaping to Twig. It defines a tag, autoescape, and a filter, raw.

trans-unit.source: The extends tag can be used to extend a template from another one.
trans-unit.target: La etiqueta de extends se puede utilizar para extender una plantilla de otra.

trans-unit.source: The extends tag is the key here. It tells the template engine that this template "extends" another template. When the template system evaluates this template, first it locates the parent. The extends tag should be the first tag in the template.
trans-unit.target: La etiqueta de extends es la clave aquí. Le dice al motor de plantillas que esta plantilla "extiende" a otra plantilla. Cuando el sistema de plantillas evalúa esta plantilla, primero localiza al padre. La etiqueta de extensión debe ser la primera etiqueta de la plantilla.

trans-unit.source: The extends tag is the key here. It tells the template engine that this template “extends” another template. When the template system evaluates this template, first it locates the parent. The extends tag should be the first tag in the template.

trans-unit.source: The sandbox extension can be used to evaluate untrusted code. Access to unsafe attributes and methods is prohibited. The sandbox security is managed by a policy instance. trans-unit.target: La extensión de la zona de sandbox se puede utilizar para evaluar código que no es de confianza. Se prohíbe el acceso a atributos y métodos inseguros. La seguridad de la zona de pruebas está gestionada por una instancia de política. De forma predeterminada, Twig viene con una clase de política: Twig_Sandbox_SecurityPolicy . Esta clase le permite incluir en la lista blanca algunas etiquetas, filtros, propiedades y métodos:

trans-unit.source: When attaching a visitor to a Twig_Environment instance, Twig uses it to visit all templates it compiles. If you need to keep some state information around, you probably want to reset it when visiting a new template.

trans-unit.source: When attaching a visitor to a \Twig\Environment instance, Twig uses it to visit all templates it compiles. If you need to keep some state information around, you probably want to reset it when visiting a new template.

trans-unit.source: When developing with Twig, it’s useful to recompile the template whenever the source code changes. If you don’t provide a value for the auto_reload option, it will be determined automatically based on the debug value.

When developing with Twig, it's useful to recompile the template whenever the source code changes. If you don't provide a value for the auto_reload option, it will be determined automatically based on the debug value.
trans-unit.target: Al desarrollar con Twig, es útil volver a compilar la plantilla cada vez que cambia el código fuente. Si no proporciona un valor para la opción auto_reload , se determinará automáticamente en función del valor de debug .

trans-unit.source: When extending Twig without creating an extension, Twig won’t be able to recompile your templates when the PHP code is updated. To see your changes in real-time, either disable template caching or package your code into an extension (see the next section of this chapter).

When extending Twig without creating an extension, Twig won't be able to recompile your templates when the PHP code is updated. To see your changes in real-time, either disable template caching or package your code into an extension (see the next section of this chapter).
trans-unit.target: Cuando extienda Twig sin crear una extensin,Twig no podr recompilar sus plantillas cuando se actualice el cdigo PHP.Para ver sus cambios en tiempo real,deshabilite el almacenamiento en cach de plantillas o empaquetee su cdigo en una extensin (vea la siguiente seccin de este captulo).

trans-unit.source: When generating HTML from templates, there’s always a risk that a variable will include characters that affect the resulting HTML. There are two approaches: manually escaping each variable or automatically escaping everything by default.

When generating HTML from templates, there's always a risk that a variable will include characters that affect the resulting HTML. There are two approaches: manually escaping each variable or automatically escaping everything by default.
trans-unit.target: Al generar HTML a partir de plantillas,siempre existe el riesgo de que una variable incluya caracteres que afecten al HTML resultante.Hay dos enfoques:escapar manualmente de cada variable o escapar automticamente de todo por defecto.

trans-unit.source: When looking for a template, Twig tries each loader in turn and returns as soon as the template is found. When rendering the index.html template from the above example, Twig will load it with $loader2 but the base.html template will be loaded from $loader1.

When looking for a template, Twig will try each loader in turn and it will return as soon as the template is found. When rendering the index.html template from the above example, Twig will load it with $loader2 but the base.html template will be loaded from $loader1.
trans-unit.target: Cuando busque una plantilla, Twig probará cada cargador por turno y volverá tan pronto como se encuentre la plantilla. Al representar la plantilla index.html del ejemplo anterior, Twig la cargará con $loader2 pero la plantilla base.html se cargará desde $loader1 .

trans-unit.source: When using the Array loader with a cache mechanism, you should know that a new cache key is generated each time a template content "changes" (the cache key being the source code of the template). If you don't want to see your cache grows out of control, you need to take care of clearing the old cache file by yourself.
trans-unit.target: Cuando utilice el cargador de Array con un mecanismo de caché, debe saber que se genera una nueva clave de caché cada vez que el contenido de una plantilla "cambia" (la clave de caché es el código fuente de la plantilla). Si no desea que su caché se salga de control, debe encargarse de borrar el archivo de caché anterior usted mismo.

With such a configuration, Twig will first look for templates in $templateDir1 and if they do not exist, it will fallback to look for them in the $templateDir2.
trans-unit.target: Con tal configuración, Twig primero buscará plantillas en $templateDir1 y, si no existen, las buscará en $templateDir2 .

trans-unit.source: With the previous configuration, the security policy will only allow usage of the if tag, and the upper filter. Moreover, the templates will only be able to call the getTitle() and getBody() methods on Article objects, and the title and body public properties. Everything else won’t be allowed and will generate a \Twig\Sandbox\SecurityError exception.

With the previous configuration, the security policy will only allow usage of the if tag, and the upper filter. Moreover, the templates will only be able to call the getTitle() and getBody() methods on Article objects, and the title and body public properties. Everything else won't be allowed and will generate a Twig_Sandbox_SecurityError exception.
trans-unit.target: Con la configuración anterior, la política de seguridad solo permitirá el uso de la etiqueta if y el filtro upper . Además, las plantillas solo podrán llamar a los getTitle() y getBody() en los objetos Article , y las propiedades públicas del title y del body . Todo lo demás no estará permitido y generará una excepción Twig_Sandbox_SecurityError .

trans-unit.target: Puede utilizar este filtro para realizar una prueba de contención en cadenas, matrices u objetos que implementan la interfaz Traversable .

trans-unit.source: You can’t define multiple block tags with the same name in the same template. This limitation exists because a block tag works in “both” directions. That is, a block tag doesn’t just provide a hole to fill - it also defines the content that fills the hole in the parent. If there were two similarly-named block tags in a template, that template’s parent wouldn’t know which one of the blocks’ content to use.

You can't define multiple block tags with the same name in the same template. This limitation exists because a block tag works in "both" directions. That is, a block tag doesn't just provide a hole to fill - it also defines the content that fills the hole in the parent. If there were two similarly-named block tags in a template, that template's parent wouldn't know which one of the blocks' content to use.
trans-unit.target: No puede definir varias etiquetas de block con el mismo nombre en la misma plantilla. Esta limitación existe porque una etiqueta de bloque funciona en "ambas" direcciones. Es decir, una etiqueta de bloque no solo proporciona un hueco para llenar, sino que también define el contenido que llena el hueco en el padre . Si hubiera dos etiquetas de block nombres similares en una plantilla, el padre de esa plantilla no sabría cuál de los contenidos de los bloques usar.
